message: this week in law,... pick a legal news of the week (eg. music industry vs amazon), have the guests to pick side, and argues for each side... Denise can be the judge who won that week...
@unwrangle I'd like to see a show about startups and new applications
I'll start, Green Tech Today,.. switch it to a more applicable ways to be green at home,.. how to recycle stuffs, etc...
let's share ideas on how to make twit shows better... (yes i know they're already awesome as it is)

ooo, you know @peterkonnecke, at this point, there's plenty of overlap on all shows about that,.. it'd probably be easy enough to cut sections together into 1 show every week about new apps / start-up :D oh and Leo also jokingly asking Scoble to host 'This Week in Next Week' on this week's twit

I know Leo isn't terribly interested, but I think there's a large, underserved (and with well funded advertisers) market for shows revolving around commercial/business IT issues. Things like MS stack vs open source alternatives vs moving toward cloud based; maintaining corporate control in the face of expanding expectations for personal applications and devices; virtualizing server and desktop environments; the emerging challenges in a newly mobile and decentralized workforce (not just sales); audit and evaluation and security vs this "new", "Gen C" workforce; how will businesses adopt and integrate in the "post PC era"; and so on.
@gschaadt why would he not be interested?
He's said it repeatedly whenever Thurrotte goes down the corporate rabbit hole on Windows Weekly.
Leo has said over and over that he has no interest in enterprise computing.

Point being - it's supposed to be a network.  Leo doesn't need to be interested.  Bring in those who are.  Fact is, a lot of the core audience for podcast consumption are IT geeks who make a living in those shops.  Security Now has a great following, and I don't think its people drifting over from Net at Nite or NSFW...
I'd like to see them make 24 hour schedules. Ie, plan the reruns.
Oh, and personally I'd like to see less 'lower thirds' - seems 90-95% of twit shows have this huge bar at the bottom of the screen - covering the image unnecessarily.
Seconded the rerun schedule. If I miss TWiG I'd love to know it would be back on at 10 or something (give or take of course).
perhaps the schedules can be published online somwhere with references to other timezones ... theres a lot of listeners outside the US/Canada time zones
@HateBadDesign I kinda wish for more lower thirds... so it has the story they're covering and a link...
@peterkonnecke if you add the schedule to your gCal, it'll use your own timezone
Twit is COMPETING with those other shows on iTunes for this space, and since I haven't watched most of those, at least in my book, he is succeeding.
I like the idea of the schedule being posted. I like the TWIT shows being long and informative.

FLOSS Weekly covers the open source things, both server and home. They could add a IT specific show, however, most of us don't want to listen to our jobs at home. If you want to learn more about the IT, but want an easy to use format, create it!
@gschaadt Agreed.  There is a market.  Question is could the TWiT format serve it?
I'd like to see TWiT be less about business and more about the tech and how it can be used.

They are trying to get Jerri Ellsworth on to explain and show her projects, and they have TWICH, not to mention PC PER. Leo also wants some of the Make Magazine people to do a show. Leo may not want to compete directly with HAK5 and similar shows, though.
I wonder how well those shows are doing - I find a lot of them ... lacking
Animated lower third popup bugs please or I drip water on this Mugwai
Green Tech Today Needs a better them song. And a few different transition themes.  Please.  Perhaps SoundCloud's new hipster, Leo's Son? Just, without the F-Bombs.

Leo has said that Enterprise shows don't interest him but he did say that he should get someone else to host it.  Someone who could make it interesting and compare conservative corporate strategies to startup style would be interesting.
@undefined Hey, he could hire Calcanis to do that ;)
drum roll
I know interprise computing that stuff if boring.
